message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the recovery of a two-dimensional vector from partial Fourier coefficients, which is a problem commonly studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and computer vision (cs.CV) communities. The use of anisotropic total variation regularization is a common technique in image processing and computer vision, which further supports the likelihood of cs.CV as a relevant sub-category. The paper also discusses the sparsity of the gradient of the vector, which is a topic of interest in signal processing (cs.SI) and multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper presents a new result on the dependence of the recovery guarantees on the separation distance between nonzero entries in the gradient, which is a topic of interest in numerical analysis (cs.NA).
